alert.note: Alert for Central Oahu; East Honolulu; Ewa Plain; Honolulu Metro; Kauai East; Kauai Mountains; Kauai South; Kauai Southwest; Koolau Leeward; Koolau Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Waianae Coast; Waianae Mountains (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 19 at 11:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Kauai, Oahu, and Niihau. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Flood prone roads and other low lying areas may be closed due to elevated runoff and overflowing streams. Urban areas may receive more significant flooding and property damage due to rapid runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Post-Tropical Cyclone Calvin may bring periods of heavy rainfall over Oahu and Kauai County through this afternoon. Excessive rainfall may lead to flooding conditions especially over windward mountain slopes.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
